description: A specific event object. An event is an action taken against an entity related to your account. For example, if you boot a Linode, the system creates an event. The events returned depend on your user grants.

action.description: __Read-only__ The action that caused this event. New actions may be added in the future.

created.description: __Read-only__ When the system created this event.

details.description: __Beta__, __Read-only__ Maintenance details for this event, if any.

complete_time.description:
The time the maintenance completed. This field is [filterable](https://techdocs.akamai.com/linode-api/reference/filtering-and-sorting) based on these parameters:

- A single ISO 8601 timestamp (`yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`), which returns only matches for that value.

- Pairs of operator string keys (`+or`, `+gt`, `+gte`, `+lt`, `+lte`, or `+neq`) and individual ISO 8601 timestamps. The `+or` operator accepts an array of values that can consist of single date-time strings or dictionaries of inequality operator pairs.

description.description: Differentiates between scheduled and emergency maintenance.

maintenance_policy_set.description: The maintenance policy the user configures for this event.

not_before.description:
The scheduled start time for the event. This field is [filterable](https://techdocs.akamai.com/linode-api/reference/filtering-and-sorting) based on these parameters:

- A single ISO 8601 timestamp (`yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`), which returns only matches for that value.

- Pairs of operator string keys (`+or`, `+gt`, `+gte`, `+lt`, `+lte`, or `+neq`) and individual ISO 8601 timestamps. The `+or` operator accepts an array of values that can consist of single date-time strings or dictionaries of inequality operator pairs.

source.description: The origin of the event. A `platform` source indicates that the event was initiated by Akamai. A `user` source indicates that the event was initiated by the user.

start_time.description:
The actual start time for the event. This field is [filterable](https://techdocs.akamai.com/linode-api/reference/filtering-and-sorting) based on these parameters:

- A single ISO 8601 timestamp (`yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss`), which returns only matches for that value.

- Pairs of operator string keys (`+or`, `+gt`, `+gte`, `+lt`, `+lte`, or `+neq`) and individual ISO 8601 timestamps. The `+or` operator accepts an array of values that can consist of single date-time strings or dictionaries of inequality operator pairs.

duration.description: __Read-only__ The number of seconds that it takes for the event to complete.

entity.description: __Read-only__ Detailed information about the entity that triggered this event.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the entity.

label.description: The name of the entity. The label may reflect changes that occur with this event.

type.description: __Read-only__ The type of entity that is being referenced by the event.

url.description: The URL where you can access this event's entity. If it's a relative URL, it's relative to the domain where you retrieved the event.

id.description: __Read-only__ The unique ID of this event.

message.description: Additional information about the event. This can be a more detailed representation of an event that can help you diagnose non-obvious failures.

percent_complete.description: __Read-only__ A percentage estimating the amount of time remaining for an event. Returned as `null` for notification events.

rate.description: __Read-only__ The rate of completion of the event. Only some events return a `rate`, such as the `migration` and `resize` events.

secondary_entity.description: __Read-only__ Detailed information about the event's secondary entity, if applicable.

id.description: The identifier for the secondary entity object.

label.description: The name of the secondary entity object.

type.description: __Read-only__ The type of secondary entity object that's being referenced by the event.

url.description: The URL where you can access this event's secondary entity object. If it's a relative URL, it's relative to the domain where you retrieved the event.

seen.description: __Read-only__ If a user on your account has [marked an event as seen](https://techdocs.akamai.com/linode-api/reference/post-event-seen).

status.description: __Read-only__ The current status of this event.

time_remaining.description: __Read-only__ The estimated time remaining until the event completes. This is only returned for some in-progress migration events. Otherwise, `percent_complete` indicates how long until completion.

username.description: __Read-only__ The name of the user whose action caused the event.
